alert.note: Alert for Howard; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:31AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sevier, northwestern Howard and McCurtain Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 531 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whitesboro to 14 miles east of Nashoba to 13 miles northeast of Fort Towson. Movement was east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Queen, Horatio, Umpire, Broken Bow, Lockesburg, Gillham, Athens, Wright City, Eagletown, Rufe, Smithville, Hochatown, Geneva, Watson, Battiest, Pickens, Mount Herman, Glover, Provo and West Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
